thread.title: Major Chains Offering Free Meals and Discounts for Veterans This Veterans Day
thread.title_full: Major Chains Offering Free Meals and Discounts for Veterans This Veterans Day

author: News Desk
title: Major Chains Offering Free Meals and Discounts for Veterans This Veterans Day
text:
Various restaurant and café chains across the United States are honoring veterans and active service members this Veterans Day by offering a range of complimentary meals, drinks, or special buy-one-get-one-free deals. Military identification is typically required to access these promotions, which are designed to show appreciation for those who have served the nation.
Among the notable participating businesses, Applebee’s is continuing its yearly tradition by providing select entrées for free from a limited menu. This marks the 18th consecutive year that the restaurant has recognized Veterans Day with special offers, and the deal applies only to dine-in customers.
Buffalo Wild Wings is also getting in on the act by offering past and present military personnel 10 free boneless wings and an order of fries, available to dine-in patrons. At California Pizza Kitchen, veterans and active duty members can enjoy a complimentary drink and entrée from a limited selection. Options range from salads to pizzas and pastas.
Chili’s is inviting service members to choose a free meal and non-alcoholic drink from a limited menu, valid at participating locations for dine-in only. Chipotle Mexican Grill is providing a different twist with a buy-one-get-one-free entrée deal applicable from 4 p.m. to 8 p.m., encouraging veterans to share a meal with someone special.
For a hearty breakfast, Cracker Barrel Old Country Store welcomes veterans for a free Sunrise Pancake Special—all day long. Denny’s is also offering a free Original Grand Slam breakfast, which features buttermilk pancakes, bacon, sausage, and eggs, available until noon at participating locations.
Golden Corral invites veterans and current service members to a free buffet dinner from 4 p.m. until close. This tradition, which started in 2001, marks the 25th year of their Military Appreciation Night. For those looking for a quick bite, Hy-Vee is providing a complimentary buffet-style breakfast in the morning, along with a 15% discount on grocery purchases.
IHOP is serving up its Red, White and Blueberry Pancake Combo, available from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m., while Krispy Kreme offers free coffee and a doughnut to veterans and military personnel. Outback Steakhouse features a free Aussie 3-Course meal, and Red Robin invites service members for a free Red’s Big Tavern Burger, complete with bottomless steak fries.
Additionally, Shake Shack will be offering a free burger to veterans and active military personnel at select locations. Starbucks is also participating by gifting a complimentary cup of coffee to veterans, military service members, and their spouses.
Finally, Texas-based Whataburger is providing free Taquitos to active and retired military members during breakfast hours on Veterans Day, with an ongoing offer of free coffee available every Tuesday through the end of the year.
These deals reflect a collective effort by various dining establishments to honor and thank those who have served, making Veterans Day special for many across the country.
